episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about a pregnant golfer who played in the US Open, the historical debate over the barnacle goose's classification, first-class passengers on the Titanic organizing snowball fights, and businesses naming themselves 'near me' to manipulate search results.

facts.fact: Golfer Brenda Keane took part in the 2001 Women's US Open while eight months pregnant and started contractions on one of her back swings.
For almost a thousand years, Christians have debated whether to treat the barnacle goose as a barnacle or a goose.
Just after the Titanic hit the iceberg, many of the first class passengers sprung into action and immediately organized snowball fights for the next morning.
Entrepreneurs have been ending their business's names with 'near me' in an attempt to appear near the top of search results.
